19907. the battle of the drib-drool continues but most of new york's	knowing sophisticates of abstract expressionism are stamping their	feet impatiently in expectation of v day	september first when augustus quasimodo's first one-man show opens	at the guggenheim	4036.155253249537
19908. we have heard that after seeing mr quasimodo's	work it will be virtually impossible to deny the artistic validity	and importance of the whole abstract movement	4075.616136764369
19909. and it is thought	by many who think about such things that quasimodo is the logical culmination	of a school that started with monet progressed through kandinsky	and the cubist picasso and blossomed just recently in pollock	and de kooning	4223.831586420407
19910. quasimodo defines his own art as the search	for what is not there	1184.1970560806683
19911. i paint the nothing he said	once to franz kline and myself the nothing that is behind the something	the inexpressible unpaintable 'tick' in the unconscious	the 'spirit' of the moment resting forever suspended like a huge	balloon in non-time	4229.673514665962
19912. it is his relentlessness and unwaivering adherence	to this revolutionary artistic philosophy that has enabled him	to paint such pictures as the invasion of cuba	3890.536674555637
19913. in this work	his use of non-color is startling and skillful	504.63620691994146
19914. the sweep of space	the delicate counterbalance of the white masses the over-all completeness	and unity the originality and imagination all entitle it to be	called an authentic masterpiece	4658.353194275343
19915. i asked quasimodo recently how he	accomplished this and he replied that he had painted his model a beautiful	shade of red and then had her breathe on the canvas which	was his typical tongue-in-cheek way of chiding me for my lack of sensitivity	4524.235483916327
19916. dear sirs: let me begin by clearing up any possible misconception	in your minds wherever you are	2110.0234709567585
19917. the collective by which i	address you in the title above is neither patronizing nor jocose but	an exact industrial term in use among professional thieves	2727.830975043313
19918. it is i	am reliably given to understand the technical argot for those who engage	in your particular branch of the boost; ie burglars who	rob while the tenants are absent in contrast to hot-slough prowlers	those who work while the occupants are home	6780.625588079139
19919. since the latter obviously	require an audacity you do not possess you may perhaps suppose that	i am taunting you as socially inferior	2332.6663618082216
19920. far from it; i merely	draw an etymological distinction hoping that specialists and busy people	like you will welcome such precision in a layman	3717.3252280301967
19921. above all disabuse	yourselves of any thought that i propose to vent moral indignation	at your rifling my residence to whimper over the loss of a few objets	d'art or to shame you into rectitude	3741.496341232236
19922. my object rather is to	alert you to an aspect or two of the affair that could have the gravest	implications for you far beyond the legal sanctions society might	inflict	5027.681538832896
19923. you have unwittingly set in motion forces so malign so vindictive	that it would be downright inhumane of me not to warn you about	them	2583.213200632898
19924. quite candidly fellows i wouldn't be in your shoes for	all the rice in china	1639.9321817634668
19925. as you've doubtless forgotten the circumstances	in the press of more recent depredations permit me to recapitulate	them briefly	1729.4030714831738
19926. sometime on saturday evening august 22nd	while my family and i were dining at the hostaria dell' orso in	rome you jimmied a window of our home in bucks county pennsylvania	and let yourselves into the premises	5919.715281789415
19927. hastening to the attic the	temperature of which was easily hotter than the gold coast you proceeded	to mask the windows with a fancy wool coverlet some khaki pants	and the like and to ransack the innumerable boxes and barrels stored	there	4388.0166027186215
19928. what you were looking for	eludes me but to judge from	phonograph records scattered about a fumed-oak victrola you danced	two tangos and a paso doble which must have been fairly enervating	in that milieu	5635.263706316438
19929. you then descended one story glommed a television	set from the music room- the only constructive feature of your visit	by the way- and returning to the ground floor entered the master	bedroom	3575.198142744053
19930. from the curio cabinet on its south wall and the bureaus	beneath you abstracted seventeen ivory metal wood and stone sculptures	of oriental and african origin two snuffboxes and a jade-handled	magnifying glass	5367.961535149805
19931. rummaging through a stack of drawers nearby you	unearthed an antique french chess set in ivory and sandalwood which	along with two box kodaks you added to your haul	3110.317875676298
19932. then having	wrapped the lot in an afghan my dog customarily slept on you lammed out	the front door considerately leaving it open for neighbors to discover	4286.666683885674
19933. so much for the tiresome facts as familiar to you i'm	sure as to the constables and state troopers who followed in your wake	2461.2474530165055
19934. the foregoing aided by several clues i'll withhold to keep you	on your toes will pursue you with a tenacity worthy of inspector	javert but before they close in gird yourselves i repeat for a vengeance	infinitely more pitiless	6174.5408680159435
19935. fourteen of the sculptures you took	posses properties of a most curious and terrifying nature as you will	observe when your limbs begin to wither and your hair falls out in	patches	3466.436735930526
19936. in time these minor manifestations will multiply and effloresce	riddling	you with frambesia the king's evil sheep rot and clonic	spasm until your very existence becomes a burden and you cry out for	release	5465.358226470934
19937. all this though is simply a prelude a curtain-raiser	for what ensues and i doubt whether any occidental could accurately	forecast it	2180.173621458914
19938. if however it would help to intensify your anguish	i can delimit the powers of a few of the divinities you've affronted	and describe the punishment they meted out in one analogous instance	5326.334641059022
19939. first of all the six figures of the buddha	you heisted- four siamese heads a black obsidian statuette in the	earth-touching position and a large brass figure of the dying buddha	on a teakwood base	3758.365842999233
19940. now you probably share the widespread western	belief that the lord buddha is the most compassionate of the gods	much more so than jehovah and allah and the rest	4659.497536153286
19941. 'fess up- don't	you	2.977635447596268

19943. very peculiar retribution indeed seems to overtake such	jokers	259.4760494264043

19945. hell's own amount of chaulmoogra oil did nothing to alleviate	their	torment; they expired amid indescribable fantods imploring the blessed	one to forgive their desecration	2592.4558133591117

19969. the	more i probed into this young man's activities and character the	less savory i found him	1424.1529265675645
19970. i learned for example that he made a practice	of yapping at dogs he encountered and in winter of sprinkling	salt on the icy pavement to scarify their feet	4659.977502716974
19971. his energy was prodigious;	sometimes he would be up before dawn clad as a garbage collector	and hurling pails into areaways to exasperate us and thereafter would	hurry to the bronx zoo to grimace at the lions and press cigar	butts against their paws	4545.378666149923
